Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class OOPrailwaySim

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.OOPrailwaySim
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants, ICommandLine
Direct Known Subclasses:
Main
public abstract class OOPrailwaySim extends JFrame implements ICommandLine, ActionListener

OOP Railway Sim by Duncan Mullier

Version 1.5 of Jar file February 2026

You should extend this class to implement your assignment, see example code below. You need to add OOPrailwaySim.jar to your project (ensure you have the latest version, see Discord)

Adding the Jar File IntelliJ

... Open your installed IntelliJ IDEA Project and Go to the File > Project Structure
Select Modules at the left panel and select the Dependencies tab.
Select the + icon and select 1 JARs or Directories option.
select OOPrailwaysim.jar.
Click on the OK button
Note: It is advised to put the downloaded jar in your project directory and not leave it in a download directory. It has been known for other programs, such as virus checkers, to move, disable, or delete files in the download directory. This class extends JFrame to provide a graphical window and implements command processing.

Adding the Jar File Eclipse

The jar file should be added to your build path. You must have created a project and be in the package explorer view if you don't see it (Window->Show View->Package Explorer)
Right-click on your project, select "Build Path-Add External Archive" and add jar file.
It will appear in your project explorer under "referenced libraries", inside the jar will be OOPrailwaySim.class.
Don't forget to look at the inherited methods from JPanel and above, which will also be of use.
Updating the Jar File Eclipse If you need to update the jar file then remove the old one by expending Referenced Libraries in your project so that OOPrailwaySim.jar appears.
Right click on OOPrailwaySim.jar and select Build path->Remove From Build Path.
You will get syntax errors in your project where it references OOPrailwaySim, but you can now add the new version of OOPrailwaySim.jar using the steps above.

What is an abstract class? An abstract class is like a blueprint that cannot be used directly - you must create a subclass that extends it. It provides common functionality that subclasses can use while requiring subclasses to implement specific methods.


This class provides:

  • A graphical window showing the railway world
  • A text field for entering commands
  • Methods to manage locomotives and carriages
  • Automatic command processing when user presses Enter

Inheritance Hierarchy:

  • JFrame (Swing's window class)
  • └── OOPrailwaySim (this abstract class)
  • └── Your custom class (must implement processCommand)

How to use this class: Create your own class that extends OOPrailwaySim and implement the abstract processCommand(String) method to handle user commands.

look at the rest of the doumentation for methods that can be used

Example Subclass:

 public class Main extends OOPrailwaySim
 {
     public static void main(String[] args)
     {
         new Main(); //create instance of class that extends OOPrailwaySim (could be separate class without main), gets out of static context
     }
     public Main()
     {

         super(); //ensure OOPrailwaySim is setup
         GameWorld world = getWorld(); //get the game world that our vehicles will go on
         setVisible(true); //make Frame visible
         System.out.println("starting");
         about(); //display about dialogue
         //create vehicles in this subclass and register them with OOPrailwaySim
         int locoId = addLocomotive(new Locomotive(world, 4,3));
         addCarriageToLocomotive(locoId, new Carriage(world));
         startSimulation();
     }


     public void processCommand(String command)
     {
          System.out.println("Command typed into text field was :"+command);
     }
 }

  • Method Details

    • OOPrailwaySimInitialise

      public void OOPrailwaySimInitialise(String trackLayout)
      Creates a new railway simulation window with a command-line interface. This constructor sets up the game world, creates the graphical window, and prepares the command input field.

      The railway world is created with a rectangular track layout including two crossing points. The window displays the world and a text field at the bottom for entering commands.

    • displayOutput

      public void displayOutput(String output)
      Display text in the output box (the top few lines of the screen
      Parameters:
      output - text to be displayed

    • onTick

      protected void onTick()
      Called after each simulation tick so subclasses can react to state changes.

      Override this method in subclasses to check for derailments or update UI state.

    • about

      public void about()
      Displays an about dialog with version information. Shows a message dialog with the current version number and usage notes.

    • captureVehiclesState

      public void captureVehiclesState()
      Stores position of all vehicles so they can ber reset with resetSimulation

    • resetSimulation

      public void resetSimulation()
      Restores the vehicles states daved with captureVehicleState

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Starts the simulation. All locomotives will start moving and the animation timer will start. This method can be called programmatically or from a command.

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation(int delayMs)
      Starts the simulation with a specific timer delay. This controls how fast the animation runs.
      Parameters:
      delayMs - the timer delay in milliseconds (lower = faster animation)

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation. All locomotives will stop moving and the animation timer will stop.

    • isSimulationRunning

      public boolean isSimulationRunning()
      Checks if the simulation is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if any locomotive is running and the timer is active, false otherwise

    • detachCarriage

      public boolean detachCarriage(Carriage carriage)
      Detaches a carriage from its master vehicle. The carriage will remain on the track as a stationary vehicle. Can be called while the simulation is running.
      Parameters:
      carriage - the carriage to detach from its master
      Returns:
      true if the carriage was successfully detached, false otherwise

    • addLocomotive

      protected int addLocomotive(Locomotive locomotive)
      Registers a locomotive that was created elsewhere. The locomotive is automatically assigned an incrementing ID number and stored in the internal vehicle list.

      This method validates that:

      • The locomotive is not null
      • There is track at the specified position
      • The locomotive has not already been registered
      • The track is not already occupied by another vehicle
      Parameters:
      locomotive - the locomotive to add
      Returns:
      the assigned locomotive ID
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive is null, no track at position, position occupied, or locomotive already registered

    • addCarriageToLocomotive

      protected void addCarriageToLocomotive(int locoId, Carriage carriage)
      Adds a carriage to the specified locomotive. The carriage will be attached to the end of the locomotive's chain of vehicles.
      Parameters:
      locoId - the locomotive ID number (1-based indexing, first loco is #1)
      carriage - the carriage to attach
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive ID is invalid or carriage is null

    • detachCarriageFromLocomotive

      protected void detachCarriageFromLocomotive(int locoId)
      Detaches the last carriage from the specified locomotive. The carriage is removed from the vehicle chain.
      Parameters:
      locoId - the locomotive ID number (1-based)
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive ID is invalid or no carriage to detach

    • setLocomotiveSpeed

      protected void setLocomotiveSpeed(int locoId, int speed)
      Sets the speed of the specified locomotive. Positive speed moves forward, negative speed moves in reverse, zero stops.
      Parameters:
      locoId - the locomotive ID number (1-based)
      speed - the speed in pixels per animation tick (can be positive, negative, or zero)
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive ID is invalid

    • startLocomotive

      protected void startLocomotive(int locoId)
      Starts the specified locomotive moving. The locomotive will begin following its route at its current speed.
      Parameters:
      locoId - the locomotive ID number (1-based)
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive ID is invalid

    • stopLocomotive

      protected void stopLocomotive(int locoId)
      Stops the specified locomotive. The locomotive will halt at its current position.
      Parameters:
      locoId - the locomotive ID number (1-based)
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if locomotive ID is invalid

    • isDerailed

      public boolean isDerailed(int loco)
      Checks if the specified locomotive is derailed.
      Parameters:
      loco - the locomotive index in the internal list
      Returns:
      true if the locomotive is derailed, false otherwise

    • toggleCrossing

      public void toggleCrossing(int crossing)
      Toggles the crossing
      Parameters:
      crossing - crossing index to toggle (0-based)
      Throws:
      GameWorldException - if the crossing index is invalid (out of bounds or no crossings exist)

    • getLocomotives

      public ArrayList<Locomotive> getLocomotives()
      Get the arraylist with all the locomtivies in it
      Returns:
      arraylist of locomotive objects

    • getVehicles

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> getVehicles()
      Get the arraylist with all vehicles in it
      Returns:
      arraylist of locomotive objects

    • getWorld

      public GameWorld getWorld()
      Get the GameWorld object so that Vehicles can be added to it when created
      Returns:
      GameWorld

    • getStartPosition

      public Position getStartPosition()
      Gets the starting position for new vehicles in the simulation.

      This position is loaded from the layout file and represents where new locomotives should be placed when created. The position is typically at the beginning of the main track path.

      Returns:
      the starting position for vehicles
      See Also:
      • getStartOrientation()

    • getStartOrientation

      public Orientation getStartOrientation()
      Gets the starting orientation for new vehicles in the simulation.

      This orientation is loaded from the layout file and represents the initial direction new locomotives should face when created. It should match the direction of the track at the starting position.

      Returns:
      the starting orientation for vehicles (NORTH, SOUTH, EAST, or WEST)
      See Also:
      • getStartPosition()

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage(String message, int alert_status)
      Display a dialogue box of type Error, Warning or Info
      Parameters:
      message -
      alert_status - ERROR, WARNING or INFO

    • processCommand

      public abstract void processCommand(String command)
      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses to process user commands. This method is called automatically when the user types text and presses Enter.

      Implementation Guide: Your subclass should parse the command string and call appropriate methods. Common patterns include:

      • Use command.equals("start") for single-word commands
      • Use command.startsWith("add loco ") for multi-word commands
      • Use command.split(" ") to break commands into parts
      Specified by:
      processCommand in interface ICommandLine
      Parameters:
      command - the text entered by the user (e.g., "start", "add loco 5 10")

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent arg0)
      Implementation of ActionListener interface - called when user presses Enter. This method is called automatically by Swing when the user presses Enter in the command text field. It reads the command and passes it to processCommand().

      The processing happens in a separate thread to prevent blocking the user interface during command execution.

      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      arg0 - the action event (automatically provided by Swing)
